issue.title: nowplayer.now.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://nowplayer.now.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnowplayer.now.com) ### Comment > Now Player Website will show concurrent playback error due to a web request being duplicated. It only occurs if the "Chinese AdGuard filter" is enabled. Username: `@stark.yc.wongpccw.com` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/drt91c5ugbkkk8k0sg0co0scss0440o7wvcx7x3ea8.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/scvedds99o0oow4ck0kkgogkc4gw800o1seh7fkuk0.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser Extension v4.3.53 System version: | Windows 10, Version 22H2 Browser: | Edge Stealth mode: | disabled Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base

Language-specific:
AdGuard Chinese Browsing Security: | disabled Browsing Security statistics: | disabled

comment.body:
@jellizaveta I know it shouldn't matter, but it is what I observed.

I have updated the Chinese filter today but sadly the request is still being blocked.

For some insight, when I tried to unblock it via clicking the entry, AdGuard actually provided several alternatives for unblocking. When I choose the first one (which includes ima3.js), no matter I enabled "Remove Query Parameters" or not, the added user rule failed to unblock the request. The one actually unblocked the request is the second one which does not include ima3.js.

I attach the blocked item details for your checking.
![block_info_1](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b67dda98-fd68-48f2-bf90-448d11eea3f0)

![block_info_2](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cfdf871b-7448-4bb1-ae92-aa07ea54997b)

issue.title: crazyshit.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [NSFW] [https://crazyshit.com/cnt/medias/176826-baby-got-back](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcrazyshit.com%2Fcnt%2Fmedias%2F176826-baby-got-back) ### Comment > The issue stems from iPhone's Adguard not properly handling iframes. There is no rule to hide the ad placeholders. On PCs, blocking the script results in a size of zero. However, on iPhones, because the iframe remains, it's natural that the ad frame does not disappear. If there are other causes for this issue, I would appreciate learning about them for future reference. > > `class="row one-column trevda mobile alt"` ### [NSFW] Screenshots [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/bvpfx854gq0o0w8wcoo0cwo04wwcgsk9mxzuckmglc.png?nc=1) ### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for iOS v4.5.5 System version: | 17.5.1 License type: | paid Advanced protection: | enabled DNS filtering: | disabled Filters: | Ad Blocking:

issue.title: Duplicate rules in Base filter
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

comment.body:
5 of the entries seem to not be 1:1 duplicates:
```
forbes.com##.top-ad-container has been made redundant ##.top-ad-container
##.ad-zone has been made redundant by #@#.ad-zone
##.ad-unit has been made redundant by #@#.ad-unit
##.ads_banner has been made redundant by #@#.ads_banner
##ad-slot has been made redundant by ##AD-SLOT
```
But even then that results in 303 1:1 duplicates, which I'm amazed in a positive way that you've gathered.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
